tools.name: 55ee860b-fe7e-4d66-a228-bb5320c3305d
tools.description: **Creates a new todo item** with the provided details. The todo will be assigned a unique ID automatically and can include a title, completion status, and user association. This is the primary endpoint for adding new tasks to the system.

userId.description: The user ID who owns the todo

tools.name: 4569a607-338e-4d66-80f7-17f911778b1d
tools.description: **Updates an existing todo item** by its unique identifier. You can modify any combination of the todo's properties including title, completion status, and user assignment. All changes are applied atomically to ensure data consistency.

userId.description: The user ID who owns the todo

id.description: The todo ID

tools.name: 888a8d15-aa30-45fe-8957-b07a8bcdd7ca
tools.description: **Permanently removes a todo item** from the system using its unique identifier. This operation cannot be undone, so use with caution. The endpoint will return a 404 error if the specified todo does not exist.

id.description: The todo ID

tools.name: alerts_query
tools.description: Returns all alerts

active.description: List only active alerts (use /alerts/active endpoints instead)

area.description:
State/territory code or marine area code
This parameter is incompatible with the following parameters: point, region, region_type, zone

anyOf.description:
Marine area code as defined in NWS Directive 10-302:
* AM: Western North Atlantic Ocean and along U.S. East Coast south of Currituck Beach Light NC following the coastline into Gulf of Mexico to Ocean Reef FL including the Caribbean
* AN: Western North Atlantic Ocean and along U.S. East Coast from Canadian border south to Currituck Beach Light NC
* GM: Gulf of Mexico and along the U.S. Gulf Coast from the Mexican border to Ocean Reef FL
* LC: Lake St. Clair
* LE: Lake Erie
* LH: Lake Huron
* LM: Lake Michigan
* LO: Lake Ontario
* LS: Lake Superior
* PH: Central Pacific Ocean including Hawaiian waters
* PK: North Pacific Ocean near Alaska and along Alaska coastline including the Bering Sea and the Gulf of Alaska
* PM: Western Pacific Ocean including Mariana Island waters
* PS: South Central Pacific Ocean including American Samoa waters
* PZ: Eastern North Pacific Ocean and along U.S. West Coast from Canadian border to Mexican border
* SL: St. Lawrence River above St. Regis

region.description:

items.description:
Marine region code. These are groups of marine areas combined.
* AL: Alaska waters (PK)
* AT: Atlantic Ocean (AM, AN)
* GL: Great Lakes (LC, LE, LH, LM, LO, LS, SL)
* GM: Gulf of Mexico (GM)
* PA: Eastern Pacific Ocean and U.S. West Coast (PZ)
* PI: Central and Western Pacific (PH, PM, PS)

UGC identifier for a NWS forecast zone or county.
The first two letters will correspond to either a state code or marine area code (see #/components/schemas/StateTerritoryCode and #/components/schemas/MarineAreaCode for lists of valid letter combinations).
The third letter will be Z for public/fire zone or C for county.

tools.description: Returns a list of zones

id.description: Zone ID (forecast or county)

items.description:
UGC identifier for a NWS forecast zone or county.
The first two letters will correspond to either a state code or marine area code (see #/components/schemas/StateTerritoryCode and #/components/schemas/MarineAreaCode for lists of valid letter combinations).
The third letter will be Z for public/fire zone or C for county.

anyOf.description:
Marine area code as defined in NWS Directive 10-302:
* AM: Western North Atlantic Ocean and along U.S. East Coast south of Currituck Beach Light NC following the coastline into Gulf of Mexico to Ocean Reef FL including the Caribbean
* AN: Western North Atlantic Ocean and along U.S. East Coast from Canadian border south to Currituck Beach Light NC
* GM: Gulf of Mexico and along the U.S. Gulf Coast from the Mexican border to Ocean Reef FL
* LC: Lake St. Clair
* LE: Lake Erie
* LH: Lake Huron
* LM: Lake Michigan
* LO: Lake Ontario
* LS: Lake Superior
* PH: Central Pacific Ocean including Hawaiian waters
* PK: North Pacific Ocean near Alaska and along Alaska coastline including the Bering Sea and the Gulf of Alaska
* PM: Western Pacific Ocean including Mariana Island waters
* PS: South Central Pacific Ocean including American Samoa waters
* PZ: Eastern North Pacific Ocean and along U.S. West Coast from Canadian border to Mexican border
* SL: St. Lawrence River above St. Regis

Land region code. These correspond to the six NWS regional headquarters:
* AR: Alaska Region
* CR: Central Region
* ER: Eastern Region
* PR: Pacific Region
* SR: Southern Region
* WR: Western Region

* LM: Lake Michigan
* LO: Lake Ontario
* LS: Lake Superior

error: Unsupported protocol version from the server: 2025-06-18

tools.name: join
tools.description:
Join a specific channel to communicate with Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the join status message.

channel.description: The name of the channel to join. Must be a non-empty string.

tools.name: select_task
tools.description:
Select and run a design task based on the task number.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects with task instructions and prompts for the selected type.

subTask.description: Optional sub-task number for design review tasks

tools.name: get_components
tools.description:
Get components from the current document, a team library, or remote team libraries.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the components info as JSON.

source.description: The source to get components from: 'local' (current document), 'team' (team library), or 'remote' (remote team library).

team_id.description: The team ID to use when the source is 'team' or 'remote'.

page_size.description: The number of components to return per page.

after.description: A cursor for pagination, indicating where to start the next page.

tools.name: set_variant
tools.description:
Create, add, rename, delete, organize, or batch create variants/properties in a component set (single or batch).

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

componentSetId.description: The ID of the component set to operate on.

action.description: The action to perform on the component set.

properties.description: Additional properties for the variant operation.

variantId.description: The ID of the specific variant to modify (if applicable).

propertyName.description: The name of the property to rename or modify.

newPropertyName.description: The new name for the property (if renaming).

propertyValue.description: The value of the property to set or update.

newPropertyValue.description: The new value for the property (if changing).

templateComponentId.description: The ID of a template component to use for batch creation.

propertiesList.description: A list of property objects for batch operations.

variant.description: A single variant operation to perform.

variants.description: An array of variant operations to perform in batch.

tools.name: get_variant
tools.description:
Get info about variants/properties for one or more component sets.

Returns: For single: { componentSetId, variants: [...] }, for batch: Array<{ componentSetId, variants: [...] }>.

componentSetId.description: The ID of a single component set to query.

componentSetIds.description: An array of component set IDs to query in batch.

tools.name: create_component_instance
tools.description:
Creates one or more component instances in Figma. Accepts either a single entry (via 'entry') or an array of entries (via 'entries').

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created instance IDs.

componentKey.description: The unique key of the component to instantiate.

x.description: The X coordinate for the instance on the Figma canvas.

y.description: The Y coordinate for the instance on the Figma canvas.

entry.description: A single component instance creation entry.

entries.description: An array of component instance creation entries for batch creation.

tools.name: create_components_from_node
tools.description:
Converts one or more existing nodes into components in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains:
      - type: "text"
      - text: JSON string with created component IDs and any errors.

nodeId.description: The Figma node ID to convert into a component.

maintain_position.description: Whether to maintain the node's position after conversion.

entries.description: An array of node-to-component conversion entries for batch conversion.

skip_errors.description: If true, skip errors and continue processing remaining entries.

nodeId.description: A single Figma node ID to select.

nodeIds.description: An array of Figma node IDs to select.

inputSchema.description: Input schema for the set_selection command. Provide either 'nodeId' or 'nodeIds'.

tools.name: get_selection
tools.description:
Get information about the current selection in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the selection info as JSON.

tools.name: duplicate_page
tools.description:
Duplicate a Figma page and all its children as a new page.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the new page info as JSON.

pageId.description: The ID of the page to duplicate.

newPageName.description: Optional name for the new page.

tools.name: get_document_info
tools.description:
Get detailed information about the current Figma document.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the document info as JSON.

tools.name: get_doc_pages
tools.description:
Get information about all pages in the current Figma document.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the pages info as JSON.

tools.name: export_node_as_image
tools.description:
Exports a node as an image from Figma in the specified format and scale.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains type: "image", data (image data), and mimeType (image mime type).

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to export. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

format.description: Optional. The image format to export: "PNG", "JPG", "SVG", or "PDF". Defaults to "PNG" if omitted.

scale.description: Optional. The export scale factor. Must be a positive number. Defaults to 1 if omitted.

tools.name: get_html
tools.description:
Generates HTML structure from Figma nodes.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the generated HTML string.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to generate HTML from. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

format.description: Optional. The HTML output format: "semantic", "div-based", or "webcomponent". Defaults to "semantic".

cssMode.description: Optional. The CSS handling mode: "inline", "classes", or "external". Defaults to "classes".

tools.name: get_css_async
tools.description:
Get CSS properties from a node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the CSS properties as JSON.

nodeId.description: Optional. The unique Figma node ID to get CSS from. If provided, must be a string in the format '123:456'.

format.description: Optional. The format to return CSS in: "object", "string", or "inline".

tools.name: set_image
tools.description:
Sets or inserts one or more images into Figma. Each image can be specified by a remote URL, a local file path, or a base64 data URI. Accepts either a single image config (via 'image') or an array of configs (via 'images'). You can customize size, name, and parent node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the inserted image node ID(s).

url.description: Optional. The URL of the image to insert. Must be a valid URL.

imagePath.description: Optional. Path to the local image file. If provided, must be a non-empty string up to 500 characters.

imageData.description: Optional. Base64 data URI of the image. If provided, must be a non-empty string.

x.description: Optional. X coordinate for the image. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000. Defaults to 0.

y.description: Optional. Y coordinate for the image. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000. Defaults to 0.

width.description: Optional. Width of the image. Must be between 1 and 10,000.

height.description: Optional. Height of the image. Must be between 1 and 10,000.

name.description: Optional. Name for the image node. If provided, must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

parentId.description: Optional. Figma node ID of the parent. If provided, must be a string in the format '123:456'.

image.description: A single image configuration object. Each object should include at least one of url, imagePath, or imageData, plus optional coordinates and properties.

images.description: An array of image configuration objects. Each object should include at least one of url, imagePath, or imageData, plus optional coordinates and properties.

tools.name: set_corner_radius
tools.description:
Sets the corner radius of a node in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the updated node's ID.

radius.description: The corner radius to set, in pixels. Must be a non-negative number.

corners.description: Optional array of four booleans indicating which corners to apply the radius to, in order: [top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left].

tools.name: move_node
tools.description:
Moves one or more nodes to a new position in Figma. Accepts either a single move config (via 'move') or an array of configs (via 'moves').

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the moved node ID(s) and new position(s).

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to move. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

x.description: New X position. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000.

y.description: New Y position. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000.

moves.description: An array of node move operations for batch movement.

tools.name: resize_node
tools.description:
Resize a node in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the resized node's ID and new size.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to resize. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

width.description: The new width for the node, in pixels. Must be a positive number between 1 and 10,000.

height.description: The new height for the node, in pixels. Must be a positive number between 1 and 10,000.

tools.name: rotate_node
tools.description:
Rotate a node in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the rotated node's ID, angle, and pivot info.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to rotate.

angle.description: The rotation angle in degrees. Positive is clockwise.

pivot.description: The pivot point for rotation. Defaults to 'center'.

x.description: X coordinate of the custom pivot point (absolute coordinates).

y.description: Y coordinate of the custom pivot point (absolute coordinates).

pivotPoint.description: Custom pivot point coordinates. Required if pivot is 'custom'.

tools.name: set_auto_layout_resizing
tools.description:
Sets hug or fill sizing mode on an auto layout frame or child node in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the updated node's ID.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

axis.description: The axis to set sizing mode for: "horizontal" or "vertical".

mode.description: The sizing mode to set: "FIXED", "HUG", or "FILL".

tools.name: detach_instances
tools.description:
Detaches one or more Figma component instances from their masters.
Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the detached instance's ID or error info.

instanceId.description: A single Figma instance ID to detach.

instanceIds.description: An array of Figma instance IDs to detach in batch.

maintain_position.description: If true, maintain the position of the instance after detaching.

skip_errors.description: If true, skip errors and continue processing remaining instances.

tools.name: set_node_prop
tools.description: Sets node properties (locked, visible, etc.) for one or more nodes.

tools.name: set_auto_layout
tools.description:
Set, update, or delete one or more layout grids on Figma nodes (FRAME, COMPONENT, INSTANCE).

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to update.

mode.description: The auto layout mode to set: "HORIZONTAL", "VERTICAL", or "NONE".

layoutWrap.description: The layout wrap mode: "NO_WRAP" or "WRAP". Optional.

itemSpacing.description: Spacing between items in pixels. Optional.

padding.description: Padding object with top, right, bottom, left properties. Optional.

tools.name: set_constraint
tools.description:
Set constraints (left/right/top/bottom/center/scale/stretch) for one or more Figma nodes.

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

nodeId.description: The ID of the node to apply constraints to.

constraint.description: A single constraint entry to apply.

constraints.description: An array of constraint entries to apply in batch.

applyToChildren.description: If true, apply constraints to all children of the node(s).

maintainAspectRatio.description: If true, maintain the aspect ratio when applying constraints.

tools.name: get_constraint
tools.description:
Get constraints for one or more Figma nodes (optionally including children).

Returns: Array of constraint info for each node, including children if requested.

nodeId.description: The ID of a single node to get constraints for.

nodeIds.description: An array of node IDs to get constraints for in batch.

includeChildren.description: If true, include constraints for all children of the node(s).

tools.name: subscribe_event
tools.description:
Subscribe or unsubscribe to a Figma event (e.g., selection_change, document_change).

Returns: { subscriptionId } for subscribe, { success: true } for unsubscribe

tools.name: create_button
tools.description:
Creates a complete button with background and text in Figma at the specified coordinates. You can customize size, text, colors, font, corner radius, name, and parent node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created button's frame, background, and text node IDs.

x.description: The X coordinate for the button on the Figma canvas.

y.description: The Y coordinate for the button on the Figma canvas.

width.description: The width of the button in pixels.

height.description: The height of the button in pixels.

text.description: The text label for the button.

background.description: The background color of the button as RGBA.

textColor.description: The text color of the button as RGBA.

fontSize.description: The font size for the button text.

fontWeight.description: The font weight for the button text.

cornerRadius.description: The corner radius for the button.

name.description: The name to assign to the button node.

parentId.description: The parent node ID to attach the button to.

x.description: The X coordinate for the button on the Figma canvas.

y.description: The Y coordinate for the button on the Figma canvas.

width.description: The width of the button in pixels.

height.description: The height of the button in pixels.

text.description: The text label for the button.

background.description: The background color of the button as RGBA.

textColor.description: The text color of the button as RGBA.

fontSize.description: The font size for the button text.

fontWeight.description: The font weight for the button text.

cornerRadius.description: The corner radius for the button.

name.description: The name to assign to the button node.

parentId.description: The parent node ID to attach the button to.

items.description: A single button creation entry.

buttons.description: An array of button creation entries for batch creation.

tools.name: set_variable
tools.description:
Creates, updates, or deletes one or more Figma Variables (design tokens).

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the result or summary.

variables.description: One or more variable definitions to create or update. Can be a single object or an array.

ids.description: One or more variable IDs to delete. Can be a single string or an array of strings.

tools.name: get_annotation
tools.description:
Get annotation(s) for one or more Figma nodes.

Returns:
  - For single: { nodeId, annotations }
  - For batch: Array<{ nodeId, annotations }>

nodeId.description: The ID of a single node to get annotations for. Optional.

nodeIds.description: An array of node IDs to get annotations for in batch. Optional.

tools.name: set_annotation
tools.description:
Set, update, or delete annotation(s) for one or more Figma nodes.

Returns:
  - For single: { nodeId, updated/deleted }
  - For batch: Array<{ nodeId, updated/deleted }>

entry.description: A single annotation operation to perform. Optional.

entries.description: An array of annotation operations to perform in batch. Optional.

tools.name: boolean
tools.description:
Perform boolean operations (union, subtract, intersect, exclude) on Figma nodes.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the result.

tools.name: group_node
tools.description:
Groups or ungroups nodes in Figma, depending on the 'group' flag.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the result.

group.description: If true, group nodes; if false, ungroup a group node.

items.description: A Figma node ID. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

nodeIds.description: Array of node IDs. Must contain at least 2 and at most 100 items.

name.description: Optional. Name for the group. If provided, must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma group node ID to ungroup. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

tools.name: delete_node
tools.description:
Deletes one or more nodes in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the deleted node's ID(s).

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to delete. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

items.description: A Figma node ID. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

nodeIds.description: Array of node IDs. Must contain at least 1 and at most 100 items.

tools.name: set_node
tools.description:
Sets or inserts one or more child nodes into parent nodes at optional index positions in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the parentId, childId, index, success status, and any error message.

childId.description: ID of the child node to insert
ID of the child node to insert

operations.description: An array of set/insert operations to perform in batch. Optional.

skipErrors.description: If true, skip errors and continue processing remaining operations in batch mode.

options.description: Options for the operation (e.g., skipErrors). Optional.

tools.name: flatten_node
tools.description:
Flatten one or more nodes in Figma, or the current selection, merging all child vector layers and shapes into a single vector layer.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the results for each node.

nodeId.description: ID of the node to flatten. Must be a Frame, Group, or node that supports flattening.

nodeIds.description: Array of Figma node IDs to flatten. Must contain 1 to 100 items.

selection.description: If true, use the current Figma selection for the operation. If true, nodeId and nodeIds are ignored.

tools.name: duplicate_node
tools.description:
Clones one or more nodes in Figma. Accepts either a single node config (via 'node') or an array of configs (via 'nodes'). Optionally, you can specify positions, offsets, and parent.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the new node ID(s).

nodeId.description: ID of the node to clone.

x.description: X coordinate for the new node's position.

y.description: Y coordinate for the new node's position.

position.description: Optional absolute position for the cloned node.

offsetX.description: Optional X offset to apply to the cloned node's position.

offsetY.description: Optional Y offset to apply to the cloned node's position.

parentId.description: Optional parent node ID to attach the cloned node to.

node.description: A single node clone configuration. Optional.

nodes.description: An array of node clone configurations for batch cloning. Optional.

tools.name: rename_layer
tools.description:
Renames one or more nodes in Figma. Accepts either a single rename config (via 'rename') or an array of configs (via 'renames').

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the original and new name(s).

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to rename. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

newName.description: The new name for the node. Must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

rename.description: A single rename configuration object. Optional.

renames.description: An array of rename configuration objects for batch renaming. Optional.

tools.name: reorder_node
tools.description:
Reorders one or more nodes in their parents' children arrays. Accepts either a single reorder config (via 'reorder') or an array of configs (via 'reorders'). Optionally, you can provide options such as skip_errors.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the results and any errors.

nodeId.description: The ID of the node to reorder.

direction.description: The direction to move the node: 'up', 'down', 'front', or 'back'. Optional.

index.description: The new index to move the node to (0-based). Optional.

reorder.description: A single reorder configuration object. Each object should include nodeId and optional direction or index.

skip_errors.description: If true, skip errors and continue processing remaining operations in batch mode.

options.description: Options for the operation (e.g., skip_errors). Optional.

tools.name: get_node_info
tools.description:
Get detailed information about one or more nodes in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the node(s) info as JSON.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to get information about. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

items.description: A Figma node ID. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

nodeIds.description: An array of Figma node IDs to get information about. Each must be a string in the format '123:456'.

tools.name: set_matrix_transform
tools.description:
Set a transformation matrix on one or more Figma nodes (single or batch).

Parameters:
  - entry: { nodeId: string, matrix: number[] } (optional, for single)
  - entries: Array<{ nodeId: string, matrix: number[] }> (optional, for batch)
  - options: { skipErrors?: boolean } (optional)

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the result for each node.

tools.name: set_grid
tools.description:
Create, update, or delete one or more layout grids on Figma nodes (FRAME, COMPONENT, INSTANCE).

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

tools.name: get_grid
tools.description:
Get all layout grids for one or more Figma nodes (FRAME, COMPONENT, INSTANCE).

Returns: For single: { nodeId, grids: [...] }, for batch: Array<{ nodeId, grids: [...] }>.

tools.name: set_guide
tools.description:
Add or delete one or more guides on the current Figma page.

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

tools.name: get_guide
tools.description:
Get all guides on the current Figma page.

Returns: Array of guides, each with { axis, offset }

tools.name: set_page
tools.description:
Create, delete, rename, or set current page (single or batch).

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

tools.name: get_page
tools.description:
Get info for one, many, or all pages.

Returns: For single: { pageId, name, isActive }, for batch: Array<{ pageId, name, isActive }>.

tools.name: create_rectangle
tools.description:
Creates one or more rectangle shape nodes in the specified Figma document. Accepts either a single rectangle config (via 'rectangle') or an array of configs (via 'rectangles'). Optionally, you can provide a name, a parent node ID to attach the rectangle(s) to, and a corner radius for rounded corners.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created rectangle node ID(s).

x.description: The X coordinate (in Figma canvas units, pixels) for the top-left corner of the rectangle. Must be >= 0. Example: 100

y.description: The Y coordinate (in Figma canvas units, pixels) for the top-left corner of the rectangle. Must be >= 0. Example: 200

width.description: The width of the rectangle in pixels. Must be > 0. Example: 300

height.description: The height of the rectangle in pixels. Must be > 0. Example: 150

name.description: The name to assign to the rectangle node in Figma. Example: 'Button Background'

parentId.description: The Figma node ID of the parent to attach the rectangle to. If omitted, the rectangle is added to the root.

cornerRadius.description: The corner radius (in pixels) for rounded corners. Must be >= 0. Example: 8

fillColor.description: Optional RGBA fill color for the rectangle. Example: { r: 0.2235, g: 1, b: 0.0784, a: 1 }

strokeColor.description: Optional RGBA stroke color for the rectangle. Example: { r: 0, g: 0, b: 0, a: 1 }

strokeWeight.description: Optional stroke weight for the rectangle.

rectangle.description: A single rectangle configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a rectangle.

rectangles.description: An array of rectangle configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a rectangle.

tools.name: create_frame
tools.description:
Creates one or more frame nodes in the specified Figma document. Accepts either a single frame config (via 'frame') or an array of configs (via 'frames'). Optionally, you can provide a name, a parent node ID, fill color, stroke color, stroke weight, and corner radius.

Corner radius can be:
- A single number for uniform corners (e.g., 8)
- An array of 4 numbers for individual corners [topLeft, topRight, bottomRight, bottomLeft] (e.g., [8, 8, 0, 0])

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created frame node ID(s).

x.description: X coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 50

y.description: Y coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 100

name.description: Name for the frame node. Example: 'Main Frame'

parentId.description: Figma node ID of the parent.

anyOf.description: Uniform corner radius for all corners. Example: 8
Individual corner radii [topLeft, topRight, bottomRight, bottomLeft]. Example: [8, 8, 0, 0]

cornerRadius.description: Corner radius configuration. Use a single number for uniform corners or array of 4 numbers for individual corner control.

frame.description: A single frame configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a frame including corner radius.

frames.description: An array of frame configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a frame including corner radius.

tools.name: create_line
tools.description:
Creates one or more line nodes in the specified Figma document. Accepts either a single line config (via 'line') or an array of configs (via 'lines'). Optionally, you can provide a parent node ID, stroke color, and stroke weight.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created line node ID(s).

x1.description: X coordinate for the start point. Example: 10

y1.description: Y coordinate for the start point. Example: 20

x2.description: X coordinate for the end point. Example: 110

y2.description: Y coordinate for the end point. Example: 20

parentId.description: Figma node ID of the parent.

line.description: A single line configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a line.

lines.description: An array of line configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a line.

tools.name: create_ellipse
tools.description:
Creates one or more ellipse nodes in the specified Figma document. Accepts either a single ellipse config (via 'ellipse') or an array of configs (via 'ellipses'). Optionally, you can provide a name, a parent node ID, fill color, stroke color, and stroke weight.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created ellipse node ID(s).

x.description: X coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 60

y.description: Y coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 80

name.description: Name for the ellipse node. Example: 'Ellipse1'

parentId.description: Figma node ID of the parent.

ellipse.description: A single ellipse configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for an ellipse.

ellipses.description: An array of ellipse configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for an ellipse.

tools.name: create_polygon
tools.description:
Creates one or more polygons in Figma. Accepts either a single polygon config (via 'polygon') or an array of configs (via 'polygons'). Optionally, you can provide a name, a parent node ID, fill color, stroke color, and stroke weight.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created polygon node ID(s).

x.description: X coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 10

y.description: Y coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 20

name.description: Name for the polygon node.

parentId.description: Figma node ID of the parent.

polygon.description: A single polygon configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a polygon.

polygons.description: An array of polygon configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a polygon.

tools.name: set_mask

targetNodeId.description: ID of the node to be masked

maskNodeId.description: ID of the node to use as mask

parentId.description: Optional parent node ID for the resulting mask group

targetNodeId.description: ID of the node to be masked

maskNodeId.description: ID of the node to use as mask

tools.name: set_fill_and_stroke
tools.description: Sets fill and/or stroke color(s) and/or stroke weight for one or more nodes.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to update. Provide either nodeId or nodeIds, not both.

nodeIds.description: An array of Figma node IDs to update. Provide either nodeId or nodeIds, not both.

fillColor.description: The fill color to set as RGBA object.

strokeColor.description: The stroke color to set as RGBA object.

strokeWeight.description: The stroke weight to set in pixels.

fill.description: The fill color(s) to set. Can be a single fill or an array of fills.

stroke.description: The stroke color(s) to set. Can be a single stroke or an array of strokes.

tools.name: get_fill_and_stroke
tools.description: Gets fill and/or stroke color(s) and stroke weight for one or more nodes.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to query. Provide either nodeId or nodeIds, not both.

nodeIds.description: An array of Figma node IDs to query. Provide either nodeId or nodeIds, not both.

tools.name: create_gradient_style
tools.description:
Creates one or more gradient style variables in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created gradient(s) ID(s) or a summary.

name.description: Name for the gradient style. Must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

items.description: Red channel (0-1)
Green channel (0-1)
Blue channel (0-1)
Alpha channel (0-1)

stops.description: Array of color stops. Each stop is an object with position and color. Must contain 2 to 10 stops.

transformMatrix.description: Optional. Transform matrix for the gradient.

gradients.description: One or more gradient style definitions to create. Can be a single object or an array.

tools.name: set_gradient
tools.description:
Set a gradient on one or more nodes in Figma, either directly or by style variable.

Returns:
  - content: Array containing a text message with the updated node(s) ID(s) or a summary.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to update.

items.description: Red channel (0-1)
Green channel (0-1)
Blue channel (0-1)
Alpha channel (0-1)

stops.description: Array of color stops. Each stop is an object with position and color. Must contain 2 to 10 stops.

gradientStyleId.description: The ID of the gradient style to apply.

applyTo.description: Where to apply the gradient: "FILL", "STROKE", or "BOTH".

entries.description: One or more gradient set operations to perform. Can be a single object or an array.

tools.name: set_effect
tools.description:
Set effect(s) directly or by style variable on one or more nodes in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array containing a text message with the updated node(s) ID(s) or a summary.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to update.
The unique Figma node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

effectStyleId.description: The ID of the effect style to apply. Must be a non-empty string. Maximum length 100 characters.

effects.description: Effect or array of effects to set directly.

effectStyleId.description: Optional. The ID of the effect style variable to apply.

entries.description: One or more effect set operations to perform. Can be a single object or an array.

tools.name: apply_effect_style
tools.description:
Applies an effect style to a node in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the updated node's ID.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

effectStyleId.description: The ID of the effect style to apply. Must be a non-empty string. Maximum length 100 characters.

tools.name: get_doc_style
tools.description:
Get all styles from the current Figma document.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the styles info as JSON.

tools.name: get_node_style
tools.description:
Get all style properties (fills, strokes, effects, text styles, style IDs, etc.) for one or more nodes.

Returns:
  - Array of { nodeId, styles } objects, one per node.

nodeId.description: The ID of a single node to extract text style from. Optional.

nodeIds.description: An array of node IDs to extract text style from in batch. Optional.

tools.name: load_font_async
tools.description:
Load a font asynchronously in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array containing a text message with the loaded font.
    Example: { "content": [{ "type": "text", "text": "Font loaded: Roboto" }] }

family.description: The font family to set. Must be a non-empty string. Maximum length 100 characters.

style.description: Optional. The font style to set (e.g., 'Bold', 'Italic'). If provided, must be a non-empty string. Maximum length 100 characters.

tools.name: get_svg_vector
tools.description:
Get SVG markup for one or more vector nodes.

Returns:
  - Array of { nodeId, svg } objects, one per node.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to extract SVG from. Provide either nodeId or nodeIds, not both.

nodeIds.description: An array of Figma node IDs to extract SVG from. Provide either nodeId or nodeIds, not both.

tools.name: set_svg_vector
tools.description:
Sets or inserts one or more SVG vectors in Figma. Accepts either a single SVG config (via 'svg') or an array of configs (via 'svgs').

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the inserted SVG vector node ID(s).

svg.description: The SVG content (raw SVG text or URL). Must be a non-empty string up to 100,000 characters.

x.description: Optional. X coordinate for the SVG. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000. Defaults to 0.

y.description: Optional. Y coordinate for the SVG. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000. Defaults to 0.

name.description: Optional. Name for the SVG node. If provided, must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

parentId.description: Optional. Figma node ID of the parent. If provided, must be a string in the format '123:456'.

svg.description: A single SVG vector configuration. Optional.
The SVG content (raw SVG text or URL). Must be a non-empty string up to 100,000 characters.

x.description: Optional. X coordinate for the SVG. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000. Defaults to 0.

y.description: Optional. Y coordinate for the SVG. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000. Defaults to 0.

name.description: Optional. Name for the SVG node. If provided, must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

parentId.description: Optional. Figma node ID of the parent. If provided, must be a string in the format '123:456'.

svgs.description: An array of SVG vector configurations for batch insertion. Optional.

tools.name: get_styled_text_segments
tools.description:
Get text segments with specific styling in a text node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the styled text segments as JSON.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma text node ID to analyze. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

property.description: The style property to analyze segments by. Must be one of the allowed style property names.

tools.name: scan_text_nodes
tools.description:
Scan all text nodes in the selected Figma node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the scan status and results.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to scan. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

tools.name: set_text_content
tools.description:
Sets the text content of one or more text nodes in Figma.
Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the update result.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma text node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

text.description: The new text content to set for the node. Must be a non-empty string. Maximum length 10,000 characters.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma child text node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

text.description: The new text content to set for the child node. Must be a non-empty string. Maximum length 10,000 characters.

texts.description: Array of objects specifying nodeId and text for each child text node to update. Must contain 1 to 100 items.

tools.name: set_text_style
tools.description:
Sets one or more text style properties (font, size, weight, spacing, case, decoration, etc.) on one or more nodes in Figma.
Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the update result.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma text node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

fontSize.description: Font size in pixels. Must be between 1 and 200.

fontWeight.description: Font weight. Must be between 100 and 1000.

anyOf.description: Font name object with family and style

fontName.description: Font name as string (family name) or object with family and style

letterSpacing.description: Letter spacing with value and unit

anyOf.description: Line height as multiplier (e.g., 1.6)
Line height with value and unit

lineHeight.description: Line height as number or object with value and unit

paragraphSpacing.description: Paragraph spacing in pixels. Must be between 0 and 1000.

fontColor.description: Font color as RGBA object - implemented via fills property

fills.description: Array of fill objects - fully supported by Plugin API

textAlignHorizontal.description: Horizontal text alignment - Plugin API supported

textAlignVertical.description: Vertical text alignment - Plugin API supported

textAutoResize.description: Text auto-resize behavior - Plugin API supported with 4 options

textTruncation.description: Text truncation behavior - Plugin API supported

maxLines.description: Maximum number of lines for text truncation - only works when textTruncation is 'ENDING'

styles.description: Text style properties object - includes all Figma Plugin API supported properties (updated with corrected truncation support)

items.description: A single text style update entry with nodeId and styles

entries.description: Array of text style update entries. Must contain 1 to 100 items.

tools.name: set_text
tools.description:
Creates one or more text elements in Figma. Accepts either a single text config (via 'text') or an array of configs (via 'texts').
If 'width' and 'height' are provided, creates a bounded text box; otherwise, creates a regular text node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created text node ID(s).

x.description: X coordinate for the text element. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000.

y.description: Y coordinate for the text element. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000.

text.description: The text content. Must be a non-empty string up to 10,000 characters.

width.description: Optional. Width of the text box. If provided, creates a bounded text box. Must be between 1 and 2000.

height.description: Optional. Height of the text box. If provided, creates a bounded text box. Must be between 1 and 2000.

fontSize.description: Optional. Font size. Must be between 1 and 200.

fontWeight.description: Optional. Font weight. Must be between 100 and 1000.

name.description: Name for the text node. Must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

parentId.description: Optional. Figma node ID of the parent. If provided, must be a string in the format '123:456'.

text.description: A single text element configuration. Optional.

texts.description: Array of text configurations for batch creation
An array of text element configurations for batch creation. Optional.

tools.name: create_vector
tools.description: Creates one or more vector nodes in Figma. Use 'vector' for single or 'vectors' for batch.

tools.name: get_vector
tools.description: Retrieves one or more vector nodes by ID(s). Accepts 'nodeId' or 'nodeIds'.

tools.name: get_protocol__by_protocol
tools.description: Get historical TVL of a protocol and breakdowns by token and chain

tools.name: get_v2_historicalChainTvl
tools.description: Get historical TVL (excludes liquid staking and double counted tvl) of DeFi on all chains

tools.name: get_v2_historicalChainTvl__by_chain
tools.description: Get historical TVL (excludes liquid staking and double counted tvl) of a chain

chain.description: chain slug, you can get these from /chains or the chains property on /protocols

tools.name: get_tvl__by_protocol
tools.description: Simplified endpoint to get current TVL of a protocol

tools.name: get_prices_current__by_coins
tools.description:
Get current prices of tokens by contract address
Error Responses:
502: Internal error

coins.description: set of comma-separated tokens defined as {chain}:{address}

searchWidth.description: time range on either side to find price data, defaults to 6 hours

tools.name: get_stablecoincharts_all
tools.description: Get historical mcap sum of all stablecoins

stablecoin.description: stablecoin ID, you can get these from /stablecoins

tools.name: get_pools
tools.description: Retrieve the latest data for all pools, including enriched information such as predictions

tools.name: get_chart__by_pool
tools.description: Get historical APY and TVL of a pool

pool.description: pool id, can be retrieved from /pools (property is called pool)

tools.name: get_overview_dexs
tools.description: List all dexs along with summaries of their volumes and dataType history data

excludeTotalDataChart.description: true to exclude aggregated chart from response

excludeTotalDataChartBreakdown.description: true to exclude broken down chart from response

tools.name: get_overview_dexs__by_chain
tools.description: List all dexs along with summaries of their volumes and dataType history data filtering by chain

chain.description: chain name, list of all supported chains can be found under allChains attribute in /overview/dexs response

excludeTotalDataChart.description: true to exclude aggregated chart from response

excludeTotalDataChartBreakdown.description: true to exclude broken down chart from response

tools.name: get_summary_dexs__by_protocol
tools.description: Get summary of dex volume with historical data

excludeTotalDataChart.description: true to exclude aggregated chart from response

excludeTotalDataChartBreakdown.description: true to exclude broken down chart from response

tools.name: get_overview_fees
tools.description: List all protocols along with summaries of their fees and revenue and dataType history data

excludeTotalDataChart.description: true to exclude aggregated chart from response

excludeTotalDataChartBreakdown.description: true to exclude broken down chart from response

dataType.description: Desired data type, dailyFees by default.

tools.name: get_overview_fees__by_chain
tools.description: List all protocols along with summaries of their fees and revenue and dataType history data by chain

chain.description: chain name, list of all supported chains can be found under allChains attribute in /overview/fees response

excludeTotalDataChart.description: true to exclude aggregated chart from response

excludeTotalDataChartBreakdown.description: true to exclude broken down chart from response

dataType.description: Desired data type, dailyFees by default.

tools.name: get_summary_fees__by_protocol
tools.description: Get summary of protocol fees and revenue with historical data

dataType.description: Desired data type, dailyFees by default.

tools.name: get_yield_pools_enhanced
tools.description: Fetch DeFi yield pools with enhanced filtering and data transformation. Returns symbol, project, tvlUsd, apy, apyMean30d, predictions, poolUrl, and projectUrl for each pool.

limit.description: Optional limit for number of results to return (e.g., 5, 10)

tools.name: generate_yield_analysis_prompt
tools.description: Generate a comprehensive prompt for analyzing DeFi yield pools data.

chain.description: Optional blockchain filter for focused analysis

project.description: Optional project filter for focused analysis

tools.name: start_evolution
tools.description:
Initialize an evolutionary solution system for a given problem with consistency checks.

This tool sets up the framework for evolving solutions across multiple generations. The LLM will:
1. Generate initial population of solutions
2. Evaluate solutions against consistency checks
3. Use crossover recommendations to create better solutions
4. Repeat until convergence or max generations

Use this tool to begin the evolutionary process with a clear problem statement and evaluation criteria.

problemStatement.description: The problem or challenge to solve

consistencyChecks.description: Array of consistency checks (strings or objects with description and weight)

tools.name: add_solution
tools.description:
Add a new solution to the current generation of the evolutionary system.

Use this tool to contribute solutions to the current generation. Solutions can be:
- Initial solutions (generation 0)
- Evolved solutions based on crossover recommendations
- Variations or mutations of existing solutions

The solution content should directly address the problem statement.

content.description: The solution content addressing the problem statement

parentSolutions.description: Optional array of parent solution IDs if this is a crossover

tools.name: score_solution
tools.description:
Score a solution against a specific consistency check.

Use this tool to evaluate how well a solution performs against each consistency check.
Scores should be between 0.0 (poor) and 1.0 (excellent).

The LLM should evaluate the solution content against the consistency check description and provide an objective score.

solutionId.description: ID of the solution to score

checkId.description: ID of the consistency check to evaluate against

reasoning.description: Optional explanation of the scoring rationale

tools.name: evolve_generation
tools.description:
Evolve to the next generation using crossover analysis.

This tool analyzes the current generation's performance and provides crossover recommendations.
It identifies the best-performing solution for each consistency check and suggests how to combine
these aspects into new solutions for the next generation.

Use this after all solutions in the current generation have been fully scored.

tools.name: get_evolution_status
tools.description:
Get the current status of the evolutionary system.

Returns detailed information about the current state including:
- Current generation and progress
- Population statistics
- Best solution found so far
- Evolution history

Use this tool to track progress and understand the current state of the evolution.

tools.name: get_neo4j_schema
tools.description:
Returns nodes, their properties (with types and indexed flags), and relationships
using APOC's schema inspection.

You should only provide a `sample_size` value if requested by the user, or tuning the retrieval performance.

Performance Notes:
    - If `sample_size` is not provided, uses the server's default sample setting defined in the server configuration.
    - If retrieving the schema times out, try lowering the sample size, e.g. `sample_size=100`.
    - To sample the entire graph use `sample_size=-1`.

sample_size.description: The sample size used to infer the graph schema. Larger samples are slower, but more accurate. Smaller samples are faster, but might miss information.

tools.name: read_neo4j_cypher
tools.description: Execute a read Cypher query on the neo4j database.

query.description: The Cypher query to execute.

params.description: The parameters to pass to the Cypher query.

tools.name: write_neo4j_cypher
tools.description: Execute a write Cypher query on the neo4j database.

query.description: The Cypher query to execute.

params.description: The parameters to pass to the Cypher query.

tools.name: access_user_specific_brand_templates_list
tools.description: Lists brand templates available to the user (Canva Enterprise only). This endpoint retrieves all brand templates the user has access to. Brand templates are pre-designed layouts with variable data fields that can be populated programmatically using the autofill API. Returns template metadata including IDs, names, and dataset schemas.

continuation.description: If the success response contains a continuation token, the user has access to more brand templates you can list. You can use this token as a query parameter and retrieve more templates from the list, for example `/v1/brand-templates?continuation={continuation}`. To retrieve all the brand templates available to the user, you might need to make multiple requests.

dataset.description: Filter the list of brand templates based on the brand templates" dataset definitions. Brand templates with dataset definitions are mainly used with the [Autofill APIs](https://www.canva.dev/docs/connect/api-reference/autofills/). This can be one of the following: - `any`: (Default) Brand templates with and without dataset definitions. - `non_empty`: Brand templates with one or more data fields defined. - `empty`: Brand templates with no data fields defined.

ownership.description: Filter the list of brand templates based on the user"s ownership of the brand templates. This can be one of the following: - `any`: (Default) Brand templates owned by and shared with the user. - `owned`: Brand templates owned by the user. - `shared`: Brand templates shared with the user.

query.description: Lets you search the brand templates available to the user using a search term or terms.

sort_by.description: Sort the list of brand templates. This can be one of the following: - `relevance`: (Default) Sort results using a relevance algorithm. - `modified_descending`: Sort results by the date last modified in descending order. - `modified_ascending`: Sort results by the date last modified in ascending order. - `title_descending`: Sort results by title in descending order. - `title_ascending`: Sort results by title in ascending order.

tools.name: create_asset_upload_job
tools.description: Uploads an asset file to the user's Canva content library. This endpoint initiates an asynchronous upload job for images, videos, audio files, PDFs, or fonts. Returns a job ID to track the upload progress. Once complete, the asset can be used in designs, referenced by its asset ID, and managed through other asset endpoints. IMPORTANT: This is an async operation. Use CANVA_FETCH_ASSET_UPLOAD_JOB_STATUS to poll the job status until it reaches 'success' or 'failed' status.

file.description: File to upload. Size limits: Images 50MB, Videos 100MB, Audio 10MB. Supported: JPEG/PNG/GIF/WebP/SVG, MP4/MOV/AVI, MP3/WAV, PDF, TTF/OTF fonts. No duplicate detection - uploading same file creates new asset.

name.description: Display name for the asset (max 50 chars). Used for searching in Canva. Longer names are truncated. Special chars allowed. Cannot be changed via API after upload.

tools.name: create_canva_design_export_job
tools.description: Exports a Canva design to various file formats. This endpoint initiates an asynchronous export job for designs. Supports image formats (PNG, JPG, GIF), documents (PDF, PPTX), and video (MP4). Each format has specific configuration options like dimensions, quality, and page selection. IMPORTANT: This is an async operation. Use GET_DESIGN_EXPORT_JOB_RESULT to poll the job status until completion and retrieve the download URLs for the exported files.

tools.name: create_canva_design_with_optional_asset
tools.description: Creates a new Canva design with specified dimensions or from an asset. This endpoint creates a design using either a preset type (doc, presentation, whiteboard), custom dimensions, or by importing an image asset. Returns the design ID, URLs for editing and viewing, owner info, and metadata. The design can be immediately accessed and edited.

asset_id.description:
Image asset ID to create design from. Optional if design_type provided. Must reference an image asset only - videos/PDFs are not supported.
Example: "Msd59349ff"

title.description:
Design title (1-255 chars). Appears in Canva UI and design lists.
Examples:
  "My Holiday Presentation"
  "Q4 Marketing Report"
  "Social Media Templates"

tools.name: create_comment_reply_in_design
tools.description: This preview API allows replying to comments within a design on Canva, with a limit of 100 replies per comment. Users should note potential unannounced changes, and that preview APIs are not eligible for public integrations.

message.description: The reply comment message. This is the reply comment body shown in the Canva UI. You can also mention users in your message by specifying their User ID and Team ID using the format `[user_id:team_id]`.

tools.name: create_design_comment_in_preview_api
tools.description: Creates a new comment thread on a Canva design. This preview API allows adding text comments to designs for collaboration and feedback. Returns the created comment with ID, author info, and timestamp. Comments can be replied to using the comment reply endpoint.

assignee_id.description:
User ID to assign this comment to. If provided, you must also mention this user in the message text using format [user_id:team_id].
Example: "oUXYegJ3p0L71iGeQqomaw"

design_id.description:
Design ID to attach comment to
Examples:
  "DAGz4y3LDFI"
  "DAFVztcvd9z"

type.description:
Type of target (always 'design' for design-level comments)
Example: "design"

attached_to.description: Required target reference specifying where comment should be attached

design_id.description:
Design ID to attach comment to
Examples:
  "DAGz4y3LDFI"
  "DAFVztcvd9z"

message.description:
Comment text (max 4096 chars). Mention users with [user_id:team_id]. No markdown support. Comments appear unpinned - users must view 'All pages' to see them.
Examples:
  "Great design! Love the color scheme."
  "Please update the logo size"
  "[oUXYegJ3p0L71iGeQqomaw:oBXYeud9amEnco9k3EsBAY] Can you review this?"

tools.name: create_design_import_job
tools.description: Imports an external file as a new Canva design. This endpoint converts documents (PDF, Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and design files (PSD, AI) into editable Canva designs. The import runs asynchronously and returns a job ID to track progress and retrieve the created design. IMPORTANT: This is an async operation. Use CANVA_RETRIEVE_DESIGN_IMPORT_JOB_STATUS to poll the job status until it reaches 'success' or 'failed' to get the final design ID.

file.description: Document or design file to import (max 100MB). Formats: PDF, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Photoshop, Illustrator, Keynote, Pages, Numbers, OpenDocument. PowerPoint loses animations, Excel loses formulas, AI/PSD may lose layers. Password-protected files fail.

mime_type.description: Optional MIME type override. If omitted, the file's mimetype is used.

title.description: Title for the imported design (max 50 chars). Shows in Canva UI and design lists. Longer titles are truncated. Special characters allowed.

tools.name: create_design_resize_job
tools.description: Creates a resized copy of an existing design (Canva Pro/Enterprise only). This endpoint creates a new design with different dimensions from an existing one. The resize operation runs asynchronously and preserves content where possible. Returns a job ID to track progress and retrieve the new design once complete. IMPORTANT: This is an async operation. Use CANVA_RETRIEVE_DESIGN_RESIZE_JOB_STATUS to poll the job status until completion to get the resized design ID and access URLs.

design_type.description:
Target design type configuration. Must include 'type' field.

Two options:
1. Preset: {'type': 'preset', 'name': 'presentation'}
   - type: Must be 'preset'
   - name: Preset design type name (e.g., 'presentation', 'whiteboard', 'doc')

2. Custom: {'type': 'custom', 'width': 1080, 'height': 1920}
   - type: Must be 'custom'
   - width: Width in pixels (40-8000)
   - height: Height in pixels (40-8000)

tools.name: create_url_asset_upload_job
tools.description: Tool to create an asynchronous Canva asset import job from a public URL. Use when you need to import an asset into Canva directly from a publicly accessible URL without S3 choreography.

name.description: Asset name (1-255 characters).

url.description: Publicly accessible URL of the file to import.

tools.name: create_user_or_sub_folder
tools.description: Creates a new folder in the user's Canva projects. This endpoint creates a single folder at the specified location (root level or inside another folder). Returns the new folder's ID, name, and timestamps. The created folder can store designs, assets, and subfolders.

name.description:
Folder name (max 255 chars). Empty names return 400 error. Duplicates are allowed. Special chars may work but could be sanitized.
Examples:
  "Marketing Assets"
  "Q1 2024 Designs"
  "Brand Templates"

parent_folder_id.description:
Parent folder ID where to create the folder. Defaults to 'root' (user's top-level). Invalid IDs return 404: 'Parent folder not found'. Get valid IDs from list operations.
Examples:
  "root"
  "FAF2lZpam2Y"
  "folder_123abc"

tools.name: delete_asset_by_id
tools.description: You can delete an asset by specifying its `assetId`. This operation mirrors the behavior in the Canva UI. Deleting an item moves it to the trash. Deleting an asset doesn't remove it from designs that already use it.

tools.name: exchange_oauth20_access_or_refresh_token
tools.description: The OAuth 2.0 endpoint issues time-limited (4-hour) access tokens of up to 4KB for user authorization via codes or refresh tokens. It requires client ID/secret for authentication.

tools.name: fetch_asset_upload_job_status
tools.description: Polls for asset upload job completion status. Use this after CANVA_CREATE_ASSET_UPLOAD_JOB to check the upload progress. Repeatedly call this endpoint until a 'success' or 'failed' status is received to get the final asset ID and metadata.

tools.name: fetch_canva_connect_signing_public_keys
tools.description: The API for verifying Canva webhooks, 'connect/keys,' is in preview, meaning unstable, not for public integrations, and provides a rotating JWK for signature verification to prevent replay attacks. Cache keys for efficiency.

tools.name: fetch_current_user_details
tools.description: Returns the User ID, Team ID, and display name of the user account associated with the provided access token.

tools.name: fetch_design_metadata_and_access_information
tools.description: Gets the metadata for a design. This includes owner information, URLs for editing and viewing, and thumbnail information.

tools.name: get_design_export_job_result
tools.description: Polls for design export job completion status. Use this after CANVA_CREATE_CANVA_DESIGN_EXPORT_JOB to check the export progress. Call this endpoint repeatedly until the job is complete to receive download links for the exported design pages. Download URLs expire after 30 days.

tools.name: initiate_canva_design_autofill_job
tools.description: Upcoming brand template ID updates require migration within 6 months. Canva Enterprise users can auto-fill designs using various data types, including experimental chart data. Monitor jobs with specific API.

brand_template_id.description: ID of the input brand template.

data.description: Data object containing the data fields and values to autofill.

title.description: Title to use for the autofilled design. Must be less than 256 characters. If no design title is provided, the autofilled design will have the same title as the brand template.

tools.name: list_design_pages_with_pagination
tools.description: Preview API for Canva: subject to unannounced changes and not for public integrations. Lists metadata for design pages with optional `offset` and `limit`; not applicable to all design types.

limit.description: The number of pages to return, starting at the page index specified using the `offset` parameter. Default is `50` pages.

offset.description: The page index to start the range of pages to return. Default is `1`. Pages are indexed using one-based numbering, so the first page in a design has the index value `1`.

tools.name: list_folder_items_by_type_with_sorting
tools.description: Lists the items in a folder, including each item's `type`. Folders can contain: - Other folders. - Designs, such as Instagram posts, Presentations, and Documents ([Canva Docs](https://www.canva.com/create/documents/)). - Image assets.

continuation.description: If the success response contains a continuation token, the folder contains more items you can list. You can use this token as a query parameter and retrieve more items from the list, for example `/v1/folders/{folderId}/items?continuation={continuation}`. To retrieve all the items in a folder, you might need to make multiple requests.

items.description: ItemTypesEnm

item_types.description: Filter the folder items to only return specified types. The available types are: `design`, `folder`, and `image`. To filter for more than one item type, provide a comma- delimited list.

sort_by.description: Sort the list of folder items. This can be one of the following: - `created_ascending`: Sort results by creation date, in ascending order. - `created_descending`: Sort results by creation date, in descending order. - `modified_ascending`: Sort results by the last modified date, in ascending order. - `modified_descending`: (Default) Sort results by the last modified date, in descending order. - `title_ascending`: Sort results by title, in ascending order. The title is either the `name` field for a folder or asset, or the `title` field for a design. - `title_descending`: Sort results by title, in descending order. The title is either the `name` field for a folder or asset, or the `title` field for a design.

tools.name: list_user_designs
tools.description: Provides a summary of Canva user designs, includes search filtering, and allows showing both self-created and shared designs with sorting options.

continuation.description: If the success response contains a continuation token, the list contains more designs you can list. You can use this token as a query parameter and retrieve more designs from the list, for example `/v1/designs?continuation={continuation}`. To retrieve all of a user"s designs, you might need to make multiple requests.

ownership.description: Filter the list of designs based on the user"s ownership of the designs. This can be one of the following: - `owned`: Designs owned by the user. - `shared`: Designs shared with the user. - `any`: Designs owned by and shared with the user.

query.description: Lets you search the user"s designs, and designs shared with the user, using a search term or terms.

sort_by.description: Sort the list of designs. This can be one of the following: - `relevance`: (Default) Sort results using a relevance algorithm. - `modified_descending`: Sort results by the date last modified in descending order. - `modified_ascending`: Sort results by the date last modified in ascending order. - `title_descending`: Sort results by title in descending order. - `title_ascending`: Sort results by title in ascending order.

tools.name: move_item_to_specified_folder
tools.description: Transfers an item to a different folder by specifying both the destination folder's ID and the item's ID. If the item is in various folders, an error occurs; manual relocation via Canva UI is required.

item_id.description: The ID of the item you want to move.

to_folder_id.description: The ID of the folder you want to move the item to (the destination folder). If you want to move the item to the top level of a Canva user"s [projects](https://www.canva.com/help/find-designs-and-folders/), use the ID `root`.

tools.name: remove_folder_and_move_contents_to_trash
tools.description: Deletes a folder by moving the user's content to Trash and reassigning other users' content to their top-level projects.

tools.name: retrieve_app_public_key_set
tools.description: Returns the Json Web Key Set (public keys) of an app. These keys are used to verify JWTs sent to app backends.

tools.name: retrieve_a_specific_design_comment
tools.description: This preview API is subject to unannounced changes and can't be used in public integrations. It retrieves a comment, details of which are on Canva Help Center.

tools.name: retrieve_asset_metadata_by_id
tools.description: You can retrieve the metadata of an asset by specifying its `assetId`.

tools.name: retrieve_brand_template_dataset_definition
tools.description: Canva's brand template IDs will change later this year, including a 6-month integration migration. API access requires Enterprise membership, providing autofill for images, text, and charts, although chart data could change during preview.

tools.name: retrieve_canva_enterprise_brand_template_metadata
tools.description: Upcoming update will change brand template IDs; integrations must migrate within 6 months. API use requires Canva Enterprise membership.

tools.name: retrieve_design_autofill_job_status
tools.description: API users with Canva Enterprise membership can retrieve design autofill job results, potentially requiring multiple requests until a `success` or `failed` status is received.

tools.name: retrieve_design_import_job_status
tools.description: Polls for design import job completion status. Use this after CANVA_CREATE_DESIGN_IMPORT_JOB to check the import progress. Repeatedly call this endpoint until a 'success' or 'failed' status is received to get the final imported design ID and metadata.

tools.name: retrieve_design_resize_job_status
tools.description: Retrieves the status and results of a design resize job. Polls for design resize job completion status. Use this after CANVA_CREATE_DESIGN_RESIZE_JOB to check the resize progress. Keep polling until status is 'success' or 'failed'. Successful jobs include the new design ID and temporary access URLs.

job_id.description:
The resize job ID returned from create resize job endpoint
Example: "ab12c345-6789-0def-1234-567890abcdef"

tools.name: retrieve_folder_details_by_id
tools.description: Gets the name and other details of a folder using a folder's `folderID`.

tools.name: retrieve_user_profile_data
tools.description: Currently, this returns the display name of the user account associated with the provided access token. More user information is expected to be included in the future.

tools.name: revoke_oauth_tokens
tools.description: Revoke a refresh token to end its lineage and user consent, requiring re-authentication. Authenticate using either basic access with Base64-encoded credentials or body parameters with client ID and secret.

client_id.description: Your integration"s unique ID, for authenticating the request. NOTE: We recommend that you use basic access authentication instead of specifying `client_id` and `client_secret` as body parameters.

client_secret.description: Your integration"s client secret, for authenticating the request. Begins with `cnvca`. NOTE: We recommend that you use basic access authentication instead of specifying `client_id` and `client_secret` as body parameters.

tools.name: update_asset_s_name_and_tags_by_id
tools.description: You can update the name and tags of an asset by specifying its `assetId`. Updating the tags replaces all existing tags of the asset.

name.description: The name of the asset. This is shown in the Canva UI. When this field is undefined, nothing is updated. Maximum length 50 characters.

tags.description: The replacement tags for the asset. When this field is undefined, nothing is updated. Maximum length 50 tags. Each tag has a maximum length of 50 characters.

tools.name: update_folder_details_by_id
tools.description: Updates a folder's details using its `folderID`. Currently, you can only update a folder's name.

name.description: The folder name, as shown in the Canva UI.

tools.name: validate_oauth_token_properties
tools.description: Check an access token's validity and properties via introspection, requiring authentication. Use Basic access (Base64 encoded `client_id:client_secret`) or body parameters for credentialing.

client_id.description: Your integration"s unique ID, for authenticating the request. NOTE: We recommend that you use basic access authentication instead of specifying `client_id` and `client_secret` as body parameters.

client_secret.description: Your integration"s client secret, for authenticating the request. Begins with `cnvca`. NOTE: We recommend that you use basic access authentication instead of specifying `client_id` and `client_secret` as body parameters.

tools.name: add_label_to_email
tools.description: Adds and/or removes specified Gmail labels for a message; ensure `message_id` and all `label_ids` are valid (use 'listLabels' for custom label IDs).

add_label_ids.description:
Label IDs to add. For custom labels, obtain IDs via 'listLabels'. System labels (e.g., 'INBOX', 'SPAM', 'STARRED', 'IMPORTANT') can be used, but immutable system labels like 'DRAFT' and 'SENT' cannot be added or removed.
Examples:
  "STARRED"
  "IMPORTANT"
  "Label_123"

message_id.description:
Immutable ID of the message to modify (e.g., from 'fetchEmails' or 'fetchMessagesByThreadId').
Example: "17f1b2b9c1b2a3d4"

remove_label_ids.description:
Label IDs to remove. For custom labels, obtain IDs via 'listLabels'. System labels can be used, but immutable system labels like 'DRAFT' and 'SENT' cannot be added or removed via messages.modify.
Examples:
  "UNREAD"
  "Label_456"

user_id.description:
User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
Examples:
  "me"
  "user@example.com"

tools.name: batch_delete_messages
tools.description: Tool to permanently delete multiple Gmail messages in bulk. Use when you need to efficiently remove large numbers of emails (e.g., retention enforcement, mailbox hygiene).

ids.description:
List of message IDs to delete. Obtain IDs via list or fetch actions.
Example: ["18c5f5d1a2b3c4d5","18c5f5d1a2b3c4d6"]

userId.description:
User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
Examples:
  "me"
  "user@example.com"

tools.name: batch_modify_messages
tools.description: Modify labels on multiple Gmail messages in one efficient API call. Supports up to 1,000 messages per request for bulk operations like archiving, marking as read/unread, or applying custom labels.

addLabelIds.description:
List of label IDs to add to the messages. Common label IDs: INBOX, STARRED, IMPORTANT, SENT, DRAFT, SPAM, TRASH, UNREAD. Use GMAIL_LIST_LABELS to get custom label IDs. Leave empty to skip adding labels.
Examples:
  ["INBOX","STARRED"]
  ["Label_123","Label_456"]
  ["IMPORTANT"]

messageIds.description:
List of message IDs to modify. Maximum 1,000 message IDs per request. Get message IDs from GMAIL_FETCH_EMAILS or GMAIL_LIST_THREADS actions.
Examples:
  ["18c5f5d1a2b3c4d5","18c5f5d1a2b3c4d6"]
  ["msg_id_1","msg_id_2","msg_id_3"]

removeLabelIds.description:
List of label IDs to remove from the messages. Common use cases: Remove 'UNREAD' to mark as read, remove 'INBOX' to archive, remove 'SPAM' to unmark spam. Leave empty to skip removing labels.
Examples:
  ["UNREAD"]
  ["INBOX","UNREAD"]
  ["SPAM"]

userId.description:
User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
Examples:
  "me"
  "user@example.com"

tools.name: create_email_draft
